intro: Melicope zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the New Guinea melicope, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rutaceae family. It is native to the Pacific Islands, particularly New Guinea and surrounding archipelagos. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported healing properties. Melicope zahlbruckneri thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests.
